title: Here's a curated list of 20 articles up to 2023 that cover retrieval-based language models, including reviews of retrieval systems and language models
**"A Survey of Retrieval-Based Question-Answering Techniques"** - This article provides a comprehensive review of various retrieval-based QA systems

author.literal: **"Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering"** - Karpukhin et al.

title: This paper introduces Dense Passage Retrieval (DPR), a state-of-the-art retrieval method for open-domain QA

author.literal: **"Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks"** - Lewis et al.

title: This paper presents the RAG model, which combines retrieval and generation for knowledge-intensive tasks

author.literal: **"REALM: Retrieval-Augmented Language Model Pre-Training"** - Guu et al.

title: This paper introduces REALM, a retrieval-augmented language model that improves performance on various NLP tasks
Efficient and Effective Passage Search via Contextualized Late Interaction over BERT"** - Khattab and Zaharia
This paper presents ColBERT, a retrieval model that uses BERT for efficient and effective passage search
**"A Survey on Knowledge-Enhanced Pre-trained Language Models"** - This review article discusses various methods of incorporating external knowledge into pre-trained language models
**"Learning to Retrieve Passages without Supervision"** - Lee et al
This paper introduces an unsupervised method for learning to retrieve relevant passages using BERT

author.literal: **"Multi-Stage Document Ranking with BERT"** - Nogueira et al.

title: This paper explores a multi-stage approach to document ranking using BERT
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** - Raffel et al
This paper introduces the T5 model, which frames all NLP tasks as text-to-text problems

**"Pre-trained Models for Natural Language Processing: A Survey"** - This survey provides an overview of various pre-trained language models, including BERT, GPT, and their retrieval-augmented variants
**"Anserini: Enabling the Use of Lucene for Information Retrieval Research"** - Yang et al
This paper introduces Anserini, a toolkit for information retrieval research built on Lucene
**"Towards Efficient and Effective Pass Retrieval in Open-Domain Question Answering"** - This article discusses advancements in efficient and effective passage retrieval techniques
**"Contextualized Sparse Representations for Real-Time Open-Domain Question Answering"** - Seo et al
This paper presents a method for real-time open-domain QA using contextualized sparse representations
**"Incorporating External Knowledge into Pre-trained Language Models: A Survey"** - This survey reviews methods for integrating external knowledge into pre-trained language models
**"End-to-End Open-Domain Question Answering with BERTserini"** - Yang et al
This paper presents BERTserini, an end-to-end QA system that combines BERT with Anserini
**"Learning Dense Representations for Entity Retrieval"** - Xiong et al
This paper introduces a method for learning dense representations for entity retrieval tasks
**"A Survey on Open-Domain Question Answering: Challenges, Methods, and Future Directions"** - This survey discusses the challenges and methods in open-domain QA, including retrieval-based approaches
**"Efficient Passage Retrieval with Contextualized Representations"** - This article explores efficient methods for passage retrieval using contextualized representations
**"Knowledge-Enhanced Pre-trained Language Models: A Comprehensive Survey"** - This comprehensive survey reviews various knowledge-enhanced pre-trained language models
**"Advances in Neural Information Retrieval: A Survey"** - This survey provides an overview of recent advances in neural information retrieval, including retrieval-based language models
This list includes a mix of foundational papers, recent advancements, and comprehensive surveys to give you a broad understanding of retrieval-based language models and retrieval systems
